text.section: There is a Cease Fire Council in the Governor's Office of Crime Control and Prevention.

section.section: The appointed members serve at the pleasure of the Governor.
The term of an appointed member is 3 years.
The terms of the appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for appointed members of the Council on October 1, 2003.
At the end of a term, an appointed member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Secretary of State Police or the Secretary's designee is the Chairman of the Council.

A member of the Council:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Council; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

section.section: The Governor's Office of Crime Control and Prevention shall provide staff support for the Council.
The Assistant Attorney General assigned to the Governor's Office of Crime Control and Prevention is the legal advisor to the Council.
